title: Petrovka Street
text:
Petrovka Street is a <a href="street">street</a> in <a href="Moscow">Moscow</a>, <a href="Russia">Russia</a>, that runs north from <a href="Kuznetsky%20Most">Kuznetsky Most</a> and <a href="Theatre%20Square%20%28Moscow%29">Theatral Square</a> up past <a href="Strastnoy%20Boulevard">Strastnoy Boulevard</a> and <a href="Petrovsky%20Boulevard">Petrovsky Boulevard</a>.
The street takes its name from the <a href="Vysokopetrovsky%20Monastery">St. Peter's Monastery</a>, situated at the top of the hill, at the intersection of the street and the <a href="Boulevard%20Ring">Boulevard Ring</a>. The street is a home to upscale shops, offices, and night clubs, such as the historic <a href="Petrovka%20Passazh">Petrovka Passazh</a> and <a href="Muir%20%26amp%3B%20Mirrielees">TsUM</a>. Perhaps the most famous building is the Moscow Criminal Police (Petrovka, 38). The Petrovka Theatre, built in 1780 at the intersection of Petrovka and Okhotny Ryad, has been known as the <a href="Bolshoi%20Theatre">Bolshoi Theatre</a> since 1824.
The street ends just before the <a href="Garden%20Ring">Garden Ring</a>, where the Hermitage Garden is located.
The nearest <a href="Moscow%20metro">metro</a> station is <a href="Teatralnaya%20%28Moscow%20Metro%29">Teatralnaya</a>, located on the <a href="Zamoskvoretskaya%20Line">Zamoskvoretskaya Line</a>.
